subject: Psychology
title: Culture and Development
description: A short lesson to help you apply Culture and Development.

hook.text: American kids say 'I did it myself!' Japanese kids say 'We did it together.' Both are doing development right.

buildup.text: Culture shapes every aspect of development â€” from parenting styles to self-concept to definitions of maturity.

discovery.text: Individualist cultures stress autonomy and self-expression. Collectivist cultures stress harmony and interdependence.

twist.text: Many 'universal' milestones are culturally specific. Independence as a goal of development is a Western assumption.

climax.text: Developmental psychology must include diverse cultures â€” or it only tells one story about one kind of childhood.

punchline.text: There's more than one right way to grow up.

quiz.question: How do individualist and collectivist cultures differ in development?
options: Individualist cultures emphasize autonomy; collectivist emphasize harmony
Only individualist cultures produce healthy development
